zos.description: Manages z/OS jobs, data sets, USS files and mounted filesystems.

usage.description: This command is used to manage z/OS job to show job status.
synopsis: zos job list status  [jobId] --owner | o <owner> --prefix | p <prefix> --limit <limit>

example.zos job list status -o zow* -p myjo*: Shows all jobs owned by user IDs starting with 'zow' and job names starting with 'myjo.
example.zos job list status TSU15026: Shows the job which job id is TSU15026.

status.description: Shows the status or detail of job.

id.description: It specifies the job id to narrow down the result.

owner.description: The owner of the jobs. The default is the z/OS user ID. Wildcard is supported, please refer to the z/OSMF Jobs REST endpoint documentation.

prefix.description: The job name prefix. Defaults is *. Wildcard is supported, please refer to the z/OSMF Jobs REST endpoint documentation.

--limit.description: It specifies limit of jobs to display.

usage.description: This command is used to manage z/OS data sets to show data set status.
synopsis: zos dataset list status [datasetName*] --dsname-level | dl <dsnamelevel> --volume-serial | vs <volumeserial> --start | s <firstDatasetName> --limit <limit>

example.zos dataset list status user.*: Show all data sets of the user "user".
example.zos dataset list member --dn user.asm: Show members of the data set "user.asm".

list.description: Shows the status of data sets.

status.description: Shows the status or detail of data sets.

datasetName.description: It specifies the data set name to narrow down the result. Wildcard is supported, please refer to the z/OSMF Dataset REST endpoint documentation.

dsname-level.description: It specifies the name or pattern of the data set. Wildcard is supported, please refer to the z/OSMF Dataset REST endpoint documentation.

volume-serial.description: It specifies the volume serial (VOLSER) where the data set resides.

start.description: It specifies specifies the first data set name to return.

--limit.description: It specifies limit of data sets to display.

member.description: Shows all members of a partitioned data set.

datasetMemberName.description: It specifies the member name to narrow down the result. Wildcard character is supported, please refer to the z/OSMF Dataset REST endpoint documentation.

dataset-name.description: It specifies the name of the data set for which you want to list the members. Wildcard character is supported, please refer to the z/OSMF Dataset REST endpoint documentation.

--limit.description: It specifies limit of data set members to display.

file.description: Manages USS files on a z/OS system.

usage.description: This command is used to manage USS files to show file status.

example.zos file list status -p '/u/user': Show the files and directories in path '/u/user'.
example.zos file list status clean* -p '/u/user': Show the files and directories which name start with clean in path '/u/user'.
example.zos file list mounts --mp '/a/ibmuser': Shows filesystems mounted to a specific path.
example.zos file list mounts sac*: Shows mounted filesystems which name start with sac.

list.description: Shows the status of USS files.

status.description: Shows the status or detail of USS file.

fileName.description: It specifies the file name to narrow down the result. Wildcard character * and ? is supported.

path.description: It specifies the directory containing the files and directories to be listed.

--limit.description: It specifies limit of files to display.

mounts.description: Shows the status or detail of mounted z/OS filesystems.

fileSystemName.description: It specifies the filesystem name to narrow down the result. Wildcard character * and ? is supported.

mount-point.description: It specifies the path where the file system is mounted.

--limit.description: It specifies limit of file systems to display.

command.description: Interact with z/OS command related services, including z/OSMF Console services, etc.

example.zos command issue console \"d a,l\" --co: Issue a z/OS console command with a console name.

console.description: Issue a z/OS console command and print the response. In general, when issuing a z/OS console command, z/OS applications route responses to the originating console. Zowe Chat attempts to get the solicited messages immediately after the command is issued. If there is no message available within a certain time interval, approximately 3 seconds if your system workload is not high, Zowe Chat returns null. Usually it means that there is no command response. However, it is possible that the command response arrives after 3 seconds. In this case, you can click the command response URL in the response to retrieve the command response.

cmdString.description: The z/OS console command to issue.

consoleName.description: The name of the z/OS extended MCS console to direct the command. The name must be between 2 and 8 characters long and cannot start with a digit. Characters are alphanumeric and can also include symbols like #, $, and @.

sysplex.description: The system name in the current SYSPLEX (where your target z/OSMF resides) to route the z/OS console command. Default is the local system.

usage.description: This command is used to show help information for commands

example.zos help list command job: Shows usage and examples of the job commands.

command.description: Shows the list or detail of commands.

fileName.description: It specifies the command resource to narrow down the result.
